project.name: releng
project.description: The official top-level project focused on coordinating and improving the creation of official releases of Gentoo Linux.
project.longdescription: Release Engineering ("releng") is the official Gentoo top-level project focused on coordinating and improving the creation of official releases of Gentoo Linux.
project.goals: The goal of Release Engineering is to continually improve the quality, timeliness and overall procedures for creating official Gentoo Linux releases, as well as acting as the official coordinators for creating new Gentoo Linux releases. This project is very much focused on ensuring that the initial quality of every official release is as high as possible, and that the "from CD" experience is as positive for as many of our users as possible.
project.extraproject: The Gentoo Store is not an official Release Engineering sub-project, but the Store and Release Engineering coordinate very closely. All official Gentoo Linux releases are made available in the Gentoo Store. In addition, all maintenance releases are made available in the Gentoo Store as soon as possible, so that customers can benefit from the latest fixes and improvements.

Release Engineering maintains its own set of hardware for development, testing and release-building, as well as the porting of Gentoo Linux to new architectures. Currently, this hardware consists of a dual-CPU 900Mhz zx6000 Itanium 2 system with 10GB of RAM on extended loan from HP, an NForce3-based AMD64 system donated by NVIDIA, and a G4-based Mac. All systems are running Gentoo Linux, and access is provided to these systems for those interested in assisting the amd64, ppc and ia64 ports, as well as those in the general Linux/free software community who need access to these architectures to perform porting/QA work. If you are a developer (Gentoo Linux or otherwise) who could benefit from access to these boxes, please contact Daniel Robbins.
